thread.title: GoPro stock slides on disappointing wearable camera outlook from supplier Ambarella
thread.title_full: GoPro stock slides on disappointing wearable camera outlook from supplier Ambarella

author: Cromwell Schubarth
title: GoPro stock slides on disappointing wearable camera outlook from supplier Ambarella
text:
Bloomberg: David Paul Morris Despite its sharp recent drop, GoPro stock remains about 80 percent above its IPO priceâ€¦ more GoPro stock dropped more than 6 percent to below $40 at the opening of trading Wednesday after key supplier Ambarella projected a drop in wearable camera sales. The lowered outlook suggests San Mateo-based GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) isn't likely to launch any new cameras on Santa Clara-based Ambarella's platform before year-end, analyst Jim Duffy of Stifel Nicolaus said in a note to investors. Get A.M. business scoops. Subscribe to SVBJ's free morning email newsletter. "GoPro's execution since the IPO has been impressive and we have increased confidence in the leadership team, but investor expectations for growth remain high, particularly into 2016," Duffy wrote. GoPro's stock has dropped 25 percent in the last three months, compared to a 9 percent drop in the S&P 500 in that time. But it is still about 80 percent above its IPO price of $24 last October. Ambarella, which makes semiconductors for wearable, flying and sports cameras, is GoPro's largest supplier, according to FactSet. Ambarella posted better than expected second-quarter earnings on Tuesday, but said that revenue from wearable cameras in the next quarter would be down both sequentially and compared to last year. The company's stock (NASDAQ:AMBA) was down about 14 percent to around $77 in early Wall Street trading on Wednesday. 
Get Silicon Valley
